detail.name: Alley Blast
detail.text: Do 12 damage to an opponent.
detail.flavorText:
“A crater in the middle of the street, so deep it had cracked the sewer below. Bodies everywhere. Muggles screaming.”’ 

— Cornelius Fudge

detail.name: Azkaban
detail.text: When you play this card, choose a non-Lesson card type. When any player uses an Action to play a card of the chosen type, they use 1 more Action to play that card.
detail.flavorText: '“The fortress is set on a tiny island, way out to sea, but they don’t need walls and water to keep the prisoners in ...”’ — Professor Remus Lupin
detail.note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).

detail.name: Black's Break-In
detail.text: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it's a Character, you may put it into play. Otherwise, discard the revealed card. At the end of the turn, if the Character put into play by Black's Break In is still in play, discard it.

detail.name: Buckbeak
detail.text: To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Whenever an opponent plays a Creature, that Creature and Buckbeak do damage to each other.
detail.flavorText: ‘Buckbeak the hippogriff was lying in the corner, chomping on something that was oozing blood all over the floor.’

detail.name: Cornelius Fudge
detail.text:
Before each of your turns, you get 1 more Action for every Action each opponent used beyond their second on their last turn.

You can’t gain Actions from cards other than this card.
detail.flavorText: "'That's Dad's boss,' Ron breathed. 'The Minister of Magic!'"

detail.name: Dementor
detail.text: When you play this card, you may discard 1 of your Lessons from play to choose an opponent’s Character in play (other than their starting Character) and put it on top of its owner’s deck. During that opponent’s next turn, they can't use Actions to play Characters.

detail.name: Filch, Hogwarts Caretaker
detail.text: You may use an Action to discard an Event from play.
detail.flavorText: ‘Filch was suddenly bustling up and down the corridors, boarding up everything from tiny cracks in the walls to mouse holes.’

detail.name: Firebolt
detail.text: Once during each of your turns, when you use an Action to play a Quidditch card, you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck, put them on the top and/or bottom of your deck in any order, and then draw a card. (When you play this card, discard the other Broom(s) you control.)

detail.name: Fred & George, Beaters
detail.text: Before each of your turns, if you have a Quidditch Item in play, do 2 damage to an opponent.
detail.flavorText: ‘“We’ve got two unbeatable Beaters.”’ — Oliver Wood

detail.name: Harry, Young Marauder
detail.text: Once per game, you may search your deck. You may take an Event from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck. Until the end of your turn, Events do not require Power that matches their Lesson type to play.
detail.flavorText: ‘“How extraordinarily like your father you are, Potter ... The resemblance between you is uncanny.”’ — Professor Severus Snape

detail.name: Homework by Wandlight
detail.effect: Before each of your opponent's turns, you may choose one of their Lessons in play. Return it to its owner's hand.
detail.reward: Until the end of their turn, your opponent may play 1 non-Healing card in their discard pile as if it were in their hand.
detail.flavorText: ‘It was nearly midnight, and he was lying on his stomach in bed, the blankets drawn right over his head like a tent, a flashlight in one hand ...’
detail.note: Play this card only if you have at least 4 Lessons in play.

detail.name: Knight Bus
detail.text: Search your deck. You may take a Wizard or Witch from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you have a Wand in play, you may put that card into play instead. Then shuffle your deck.

detail.name: Nightly Practices
detail.text: When you play a Beater, Chaser, Keeper, or Seeker, you may choose an opponent. If they have any cards in play, they choose 1 of them and discard it.
detail.flavorText: ‘He therefore increased the number of team practices to five a week.’

detail.name: Professor Remus Lupin
detail.text: Once per turn, you may use an Action to choose an opponent's non-Lesson card in play and a card in their discard pile with the same name. Put both on the bottom of their deck. (You must choose 2 cards.)

detail.name: Professor Rubeus Hagrid
detail.text: Once during each of your turns, when you discard 1 of your Lessons from play, you may draw a card and put 1 Lesson from your discard pile into your hand.
detail.flavorText: ‘“Yer in my firs’ ever lesson! Right after lunch! Bin up since five gettin’ everythin’ ready.”’ — Professor Rubeus Hagrid

detail.name: Professor Sybill Trelawney
detail.text: Before each of your turns, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them on the top and/or bottom of your deck in any order.
detail.flavorText: ‘“I have been crystal gazing … and to my astonishment, I saw myself abandoning my solitary luncheon and coming to join you. Who am I to refuse the promptings of fate?”’ — Professor Sybill Trelawney

detail.name: Secret-Keeper
detail.text: When the last card would leave your deck, discard this card from play instead. If you do, put any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck in any order, and cards cannot leave your deck until the end of the turn. When you build your deck, you can put only 1 Secret-Keeper in it.   (This effect occurs during other card effects.)

detail.name: Sir Cadogan
detail.text: Once during each of your turns, when you play a card with an even printed Power cost, you may draw a card, and then you may put a Lesson from your hand into play.
detail.flavorText: ‘“Come follow me, dear friends, and we shall find our goal, or else shall perish bravely in the charge!”’ — Sir Cadogan

detail.name: Sirius Black
detail.text: For every 3 different card types in your discard pile, your opponents' cards require 1 more Power to play.
detail.flavorText: ". . . He was clever enough to escape from Azkaban, and that’s supposed to be impossible." — Arthur Weasley

detail.name: Stan Shunpike
detail.text: Once per turn, you may use an Action to choose a Location in play and do damage to an opponent equal to its printed Power cost.
detail.flavorText: ‘ ... Stan Shunpike was ... eighteen or nineteen at most, with large, protruding ears and quite a few pimples.’

detail.name: The Marauder's Map
detail.text: Once during each of your turns, you may search your deck. You may take an Adventure or Event from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

detail.name: 12 Years in Azkaban
detail.text: Whenever you take damage, prevent up to 2 of that damage. If this card has prevented at least 12 damage, it no longer prevents damage and instead Provides .
detail.flavorText: 'Did he realize he was facing twelve years in Azkaban, twelve years that would make him unrecognizable?'

detail.name: At the Three Broomsticks
detail.effect: Whenever your opponent uses an Action to play a card, you may choose a non-Healing card from your discard pile and put it on the bottom of your deck.
detail.toSolve: Your opponent uses Actions to play cards 10 times.
detail.reward: Your opponent may search their deck for a Spell, reveal it, put it into their hand, and then shuffle their deck.

detail.name: Azkaban Breakout
detail.text: To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Put up to 3 non-Healing Characters from your discard pile into your hand.
detail.flavorText: "Never been a breakout from Azkaban before, ’as there, Ern?" — Stan Shunpike

detail.name: Boggart
detail.text: Boggart's damage per turn is equal to the number of different card types in all opponents' discard piles.
detail.flavorText: ‘“It’s a shapeshifter. It can take the shape of whatever it thinks will frighten us most.”’ — Hermione Granger

detail.name: Confiscated!
detail.text: Look at an opponent's hand. You may choose a non-Lesson card from it. Discard each of their cards in play and in their hand with the same name as the chosen card.
detail.flavorText: ‘“May I?” said Professor McGonagall, but she didn’t wait for an answer before pulling the Firebolt out of their hands.’

detail.name: Dementors on the Pitch
detail.effect: When you play this card, discard any Match in play (nobody gets the Prize). Your opponent can't use Actions to play Matches.
detail.toSolve: Your opponent skips a total of 4 Actions.
detail.reward: Your opponent may discard a Match in play. Then they may put a Match from their discard pile into play.

detail.name: Eavesdropping on the Weasleys
detail.effect: At the end of each of your turns, your opponent names a card. Prevent all damage dealt to you on your opponent's next turn from all other cards (even the turn this Adventure is solved).
detail.toSolve: Your opponent does damage to you 4 times.
detail.reward: Your opponent gets 1 more Action (the turn this Adventure is solved).

detail.name: Egyptian Holiday
detail.text: Whenever an opponent uses a third Action in a turn, do 5 damage to them.
detail.flavorText: ‘“I don’t think Egypt agreed with him.”’ — Ron Weasley

detail.name: Flight of the Fat Lady
detail.text: Choose 1 of an opponent's cards in play and return it to its owner's hand. If you have fewer cards in play than that opponent, you get 1 more Action this turn.

detail.name: Grim Sighting
detail.text: At the end of each of your turns, you may take damage until you discard a Lesson. If you do, during an opponent's next turn, their starting Character loses all abilities.

detail.name: Handbook of Do-It-Yourself Broomcare
detail.text: During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, until the end of this turn, Brooms require 2 less Power to play and you may play Brooms from your discard pile as if they were in your hand.

detail.name: Hermes
detail.text: When you play this card, you may discard 1 of your Lessons from play to put a non-Healing Spell from your discard pile into your hand.

detail.name: Hippogriff Ride
detail.text: At the end of each of your turns, if at least 1 of your Creatures did damage this turn, draw 2 cards. When any of your Creatures are discarded from play, discard this card from play.
detail.flavorText: ‘“Righ’ then, Harry,” said Hagrid. “I reckon he might’ let yeh ride him!”’

detail.name: Impervius
detail.text: Choose an opponent. During their next turn, prevent the first 3 damage done to you. Before your next turn, draw a card for each damage prevented in this way.
detail.flavorText: ‘Harry was still numb with cold, still wetter than he’d ever been in his life, but he could see.’

detail.name: Impromptu Inspection
detail.text: When you play this card, choose a non-Lesson card type. Whenever an opponent plays a card of the chosen card type, you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw a card.

detail.name: Inheriting the Map
detail.text: Search your deck. You may take an Item or Spell from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck. You may use an Action to repeat this Spell.
detail.flavorText: "‘Anyway, we know it by heart,” said George. “We bequeath it to you. We don’t really need it anymore.”’

detail.name: Intermediate Transfiguration
detail.text: Your Items do not require Power that matches their Lesson type to play.

detail.name: List of Passwords
detail.text: Before each of your turns, you may put a Password from your discard pile into your hand.

detail.name: McGonagall's Office
detail.text: Each player may only use Actions to play 1 non-Lesson card of each card type every turn (even the turn this card leaves play).
detail.note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).

detail.name: Mobiliarbus
detail.text: Search your deck. You may take a Plant from your deck with printed Power cost less than or equal to your current Power, reveal it, and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

detail.name: Quidditch Changing Room
detail.text: Whenever a player uses an Action to play a Beater, Chaser, Keeper, or Seeker, they may search their deck. They may take a Quidditch Item or Spell from their deck, reveal it, and put it into their hand. Then they shuffle their deck.
detail.note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).

detail.name: Riddikulus!
detail.text: Choose an opponent's Creature or Item in play and return it to its owner's hand. Then look at that opponent's hand and choose a Creature or Item they can play, if any. They put it into play.

detail.name: Security Troll
detail.text: To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Your Creatures in play not named Security Troll cannot be chosen by opponents.
detail.flavorText: ‘They paced the corridor in a menacing group, talking in grunts and comparing the size of their clubs.’

detail.name: Teacups and Tea Leaves
detail.text: At the end of each of your turns, you may discard the top card of your deck. If it is a Spell, do 2 damage to an opponent. If it is a Divination card, do 3 damage to an opponent. If it is a Lesson, put it into play. If it is a Character, put it into your hand.

detail.name: The North Tower
detail.text: During each player's turn, whenever they draw 1 or more cards, except during their draw step, each of their opponents draws 2 cards.
detail.note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).

detail.name: The Standard Book of Spells (Grade 3)
detail.text: Whenever you play a Spell, do 1 damage to an opponent.

detail.name: Thunderstorm Match
detail.toSolve: Use Actions to play Creatures 3 times.
detail.reward: The winner chooses up to 2 Lessons in their discard pile and puts them into play.
detail.flavorText: ‘Harry knew better than to think the match would be canceled; Quidditch matches weren’t called off for trifles like thunderstorms.’

detail.name: Unworthy Trick
detail.text: Choose a number between 1 and 10. Do that much damage to an opponent. If 3 or more Lessons were discarded, that opponent shuffles all cards discarded by this effect back into their deck.

detail.name: Wanted Poster
detail.text: When you play this card, name a non-Lesson card. When any player uses an Action to play the named card, they use 1 more Action to play that card.

detail.name: Ballooning Aunt
detail.text: Choose an Event in play and discard it. Then draw a card.
detail.flavorText: ‘She was entirely round, now, like a vast life buoy with piggy eyes, and her hands and feet stuck out weirdly as she drifted up into the air, making apoplectic popping noises.’

detail.name: Best Practice Ever
detail.text: Count the number of Beaters, Chasers, Keepers, and Seekers you have in play. Do that much damage to an opponent.
detail.flavorText: ‘... by the time they hit the ground again, Wood didn’t have a single criticism to make, which, as George Weasley pointed out, was a first.’

detail.name: Bowing to a Hippogriff
detail.text: The next Creature you play this turn requires 3 less Power to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches.)
detail.flavorText: ‘“Tha’s it,” said Hagrid. “Tha’s it, Harry ... now, bow ...”’

detail.name: Brass Scales
detail.text: Once during each of your turns, you may play a non-Healing Potions Item from your discard pile as if it were in your hand.

detail.name: Broaden Your Minds
detail.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Put 1 of them into your hand, and the rest on the bottom of your deck in any order. You may use an Action to repeat this Spell.

detail.name: Broomstick Compass
detail.text: If you have a Broom in play, this card Provides .

detail.name: Chocolate
detail.text: Put 1 of your Characters discarded during an opponent's last turn from your discard pile into your hand. Then draw a card.
detail.flavorText: ‘“So we’ve finally got a Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher who knows his remedies?”’ — Madam Pomfrey

detail.name: Destroyed Broom
detail.text: Do 4 damage to an opponent. During their next turn, their non-Lesson cards do not provide Power.
detail.flavorText: ‘Slowly, she reached down for a bag at her feet, turned it upside down, and tipped a dozen bits of splintered wood and twig onto the bed, the only remains of Harry’s faithful, finally beaten broomstick.’

detail.name: Dirty Game
detail.text: Do 4 damage to an opponent. Then, if that opponent has any Events in play, they choose 1 of them and discards it.
detail.flavorText: ‘It was turning into the dirtiest game Harry had ever played in.’

detail.name: Fast Swerve
detail.text: Choose an opponent. During their next turn, whenever you take damage, prevent half of it (rounded up). At the end of that opponent's turn, if this card's effect prevented 3 or less damage total, you may return this card from your discard pile to your hand.

detail.name: Flibbertigibbet
detail.text: When you play this card, play it face down and tell an opponent to guess "Flibbertigibbet", "Fortuna Major", "Oddsbodikins", or "Scurvy Cur". If they guess "Flibbertigibbet", each player discards 1 card from their hand. Otherwise, look at that opponent's hand. You may choose up to 2 of those cards and discard them.

detail.name: Fortuna Major
detail.text: When you play this card, play it face down and tell an opponent to guess "Flibbertigibbet", "Fortuna Major", "Oddsbodikins", or "Scurvy Cur". If they guess "Fortuna Major", each player draws a card. Otherwise, look at up to the top 10 cards of your deck and put them back in any order, then draw 2 cards.

detail.name: Gryffindor Steals
detail.text: Do 4 damage to an opponent. Then, if that opponent has any Lessons in play, they choose 1 of them and put it on top of its owner’s deck.
detail.flavorText: ‘“Gryffindor in possession, no, Slytherin in possession — no! — Gryffindor back in possession …’” — Lee Jordan, commentator

detail.name: Hogwarts Quidditch Robes
detail.text: At the end of each of your turns, if you played a Quidditch card, you may put 1 non-Healing card from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.

detail.name: Hooch Watches Practice
detail.text: When a Match is discarded from play, you may return it to play under its owner’s control. If you do, discard this card.
detail.flavorText: ‘Undaunted, the Gryffindor team was training harder than ever under the eye of Madam Hooch.

detail.name: I Solemnly Swear
detail.text: To play this card, discard 3 cards from your hand. Search your deck. You may put up to 2 Lessons from your deck into play. Then shuffle your deck.

detail.name: Inner Eye
detail.text: Before each of your turns, your opponent may reveal a Lesson from their hand. If they do not, you may put a Lesson from your hand into play.
detail.flavorText: ‘“One hopes, however, that one might have mistaken the Signs. ... The Inner Eye can be a burden, you know.”’  — Professor Sybill Trelawney

detail.name: Insulting a Hippogriff
detail.text: Play this card only if you have a Creature in play. Choose an opponent's Character in play (other than their starting Character) and discard it.
detail.flavorText: ‘“I bet you’re not dangerous at all, are you?” he said to the hippogriff. “Are you, you great ugly brute?”’

detail.name: Knight Bus Ride
detail.text: To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Choose an Adventure or Event in play and discard it. (You do not get the reward.)
detail.flavorText: ‘There was another tremendous BANG, and the next moment Harry found himself flat on his bed, thrown backward by the speed of the Knight Bus.’

detail.name: Laughing at a Boggart
detail.text: Choose an opponent's Creature in play and put it on top of its owner's deck. If that Creature did damage to you during their last turn, do that much damage to that opponent.

detail.name: Lumos!
detail.text:
Choose two of the following, then shuffle this card into your deck:
  • Do 1 damage to an opponent.
  • Look at an opponent’s hand.
  • Draw a card.

detail.name: Malicious Substitute
detail.text: Do 5 damage to an opponent or to a Creature of your choice. Your opponent may prevent this damage by revealing a Creature from their hand.
detail.flavorText: ‘But it wasn’t Professor Lupin who looked up at him from the teacher’s desk; it was Snape.’

detail.name: Mischief Managed
detail.text: Choose an opponent's card in play. During their next turn, that card loses all abilities and damage per turn. If you have another Marauder card in play, you get 1 more Action this turn.

detail.name: Oddsbodikins
detail.text: When you play this card, play it face down and tell an opponent to guess "Flibbertigibbet", "Fortuna Major", "Oddsbodikins", or "Scurvy Cur". If they guess "Oddsbodikins", do 2 damage to each player. Otherwise, do 8 damage to that opponent.

detail.name: Overloaded Schedule
detail.text: Count the number of Lessons of different types you have in play. Draw twice that many cards.

detail.name: Palmistry
detail.text: Reveal the top card of your deck. You may then reveal a card in your hand with a matching card type. If you do, put the cards revealed this way into your hand, and then do 6 damage to an opponent. Otherwise, you may put that card either on the top or bottom of your deck.

detail.name: Perfumed Smoke
detail.text: Draw 2 cards. Then choose a card in your hand and shuffle it into your deck.
detail.flavorText: The heavily perfumed smoke in the room was making him feel sleepy and stupid.

detail.name: Pet Cat
detail.text: When you play this card, draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.
detail.flavorText: ‘Then there were cats of every colour ...’

detail.name: Pet Spider
detail.text: Whenever an opponent uses an Action to play a Spell, do 2 damage to them.
detail.flavorText: ‘“C’mon … gotta get yeh outta here … c’mon now … in the box …”’ — Rubeus Hagrid

detail.name: Potion Experiment No. 7
detail.text: To play this card, return 1 of your Lessons from play to your hand. Do 4 damage to an opponent or to a Creature of your choice.

detail.name: Rat Tonic
detail.text: When 1 of your Creatures with printed Power cost of 3 or less would be discarded from play due to damage or an opponent's card, remove all damage counters from that Creature and discard this card instead.

detail.name: Red Cap
detail.text: You may use an Action to discard a Lesson from your hand. If you do, do 3 damage to an opponent.
detail.flavorText: ‘ ... they studied Red Caps, nasty little goblinlike creatures that lurked wherever there had been bloodshed ...’

detail.name: Rescheduled Match
detail.text: Discard a Match in play, then you may put a non-Healing Match from your discard pile into play. If you do, do 3 damage to an opponent.
detail.flavorText: ‘“We’re not playing Slytherin!” he told them, looking very angry. “Flint’s just been to see me. We’re playing Hufflepuff instead.’”

detail.name: Scurvy Cur
detail.text: When you play this card, play it face down and tell an opponent to guess "Flibbertigibbet", "Fortuna Major", "Oddsbodikins", or "Scurvy Cur". If they guess "Scurvy Cur", each player returns 1 of their non-Healing cards in play to its owner's hand. Otherwise, choose up to 2 of that opponent's cards in play and return them to their owner's hand.

detail.name: The Monster Book of Monsters
detail.flavorText: ‘“Oh, how silly we’ve all been! We should have stroked them! Why didn’t we guess!”’ — Draco Malfoy

detail.name: Trelawny Reading
detail.text: Reveal the top card of your deck, then put it into your hand. If it is a Spell, draw 2 cards.

detail.name: Unfogging the Future
detail.text: Once during each of your turns, you may look at the top card of your deck. During your turn, you may discard Unfogging the Future from play. If you do, draw a card and put a card from your hand on top of your deck.

detail.name: Waddiwasi
detail.text: Do 3 damage to an opponent. You may discard 1 of your Items in play. If you do, do damage to that opponent equal to the Item's printed Power cost.
detail.flavorText: ‘“Cool, sir!”’ — Dean Thomas

detail.name: Winged Boar
detail.flavorText: ‘... the carriage trundled toward a pair of magnificent wrought iron gates, flanked with stone columns topped with winged boars ...’

detail.name: Wolfsbane Potion
detail.text: To play this card, return 1 of your Lessons from play to your hand. Shuffle up to 8 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck.
detail.flavorText: ‘“I am able to curl up in my office, a harmless wolf, and wait for the moon to wane again.”’  — Professor Remus Lupin
